result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 a.m. Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Carol Roberts appearing by telephone with leave of court. State moves to amend Count 1 - 4th degree sexual assault, violation of 940.225(3m) and Count 2 to lewd and lascivious behavior - violation of 944.20 - Class A Misdemeanors - Granted. State has complied with victim rights legislation. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Roberts/Michlig/Snyder/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Count 1
Court costs-  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail - 9 months with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 9 months - time served

Count 2
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
   Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
PO agent to take into consideration the nature of charges.
No contact WHATSOEVER with victim.
DNA Sample
 The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Stipulation between parties for no credit if revoked for time served on Count 2. 

Roberts statement to Court on sentence.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj.  11:13 a.m.

9:13 a.m. Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Snyder statement to stipulation to obtain medical records; mother is willing to sign authorizations but mother does not have custody of minor child - Snyder moves to hold motions until it is determined that authorizations will be honored by medical facilities - Michlig statement to motion. Snyder agrees to share medical records with State. Court holds ruling on motions until issue of receipt of medical records is determined. Bail continued. Adj. 9:25 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.
for examination of alleged victim's mental health care records and for examination of alleged victim

11:03 a.m. Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Snyder statement - evidentiary issues still to be resolved - intends to file motions and requests hearing date for motions. Michlig statement - Snyder to file motions within 20 days.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

11:20 a.m. Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim appearing by telephone with leave of Court. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading of Information.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Bail continued. Adj. 11:23 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:06 pm - Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court, via video,  with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with any underage females

01:48 pm - Defendant Daniel E. Kulwicki in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states has an attorney, Daniel Snyder, has not contacted yet.  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
